Review.Contenu: This is just a scam. Plain and simple. They advertise as FREE QR generator but never mention it is only for a trial period. Then they charge you 35$ per month to use your QR. There was nowhere in their site a reference about their pricing list nor did they mention anything about trial mode. I would not recommend using their service unless you are willing to pay annually 350 $.

Review.Titre: 4 or 5 star reviews are yet to discover the 400 dollar catch
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately most positive reviews on Trustpilot for qr.io have 'just created a code' or similar and are yet to discover that they will need to pay 35 dollars every month or face losing the use of the QR code. Creating and using QR codes is usually a free service without a catch. Sadly qr.io are charging more than 400 dollars per annum for the same service.

This company needs to investigated on a federal level.The only positive reviews here seems fabricated and completely fake.This website presents an easy way to make beautiful qr codes. These codes link to whatever you like eg a URL. They work for a week or two and then suddenly demand payment of USD35/month. Ok fair enough they never mention FREE on their site but there pricing structure remains elusive until you hunt for it and it lets you generate the QR codes without prompt or mention.They also come up as a top hit upon googling "FREE QR generator". They know exactly what they are doing. Shame on you all.

Review.Titre: It is NOT FREE.. Turned out it's a 7 days trial!!
Review.Contenu: Turned out it's a 7 days trial!Recently generated QR for an event which I thought is free to use. Once the fliers are published and shared all over, then only I realised that the QR is not working anymore. Luckily the flier had the original link and escaped from this scam.

This website is a scam, pure and simple. It came top of the advertising list when Googling “Free to use QR codes”, but having embedded one of their QR codes into a leaflet, which I had printed thousands of, I discovered upon scanning it to test (which I had done many times at the proofing stage) that the code had expired and I now need to pay $35 per month to subscribe to their plan and re-activate it. Nowhere was this made clear on their website. I've used many QR code generators over the years and have never been scammed in this way before.It seems from reading many other reviews that I’m by no means their only victim, and makes me wonder how many other businesses/charities/individuals have been conned in this way, and wasted thousands in printing costs. Is a single one of their positive reviews genuine?Avoid this site at all costs.

Review.Titre: This isn’t free and you will be expected to pay $35 just for your code to work. We used this for baby registry codes and now have to pay every month till the baby shower for people to get to it
Review.Contenu: Contrary to the link and Google name this isn’t a free generator as your codes will expire after 7 days. It does not tell you the monthly charge you will need to pay until AFTER the “trial” is over which is $35 of $350 for the year.  There is also no page disclosing it’s a trial. Upon making a new link and account it’s fine print at the top after the codes already been generated and downloaded. We used this for our baby shower and now have to pay every month so people can access the code we put on our invitations. Be careful because they are not upfront with their information and now we are going to be out $100+ because of it.

Scam! They suck you in with a free trial which states that QR codes will continue to work after the trial. Guess what! They don't and you are then forced to pay an unreasonable amount of money to continue using your QR code.There are literally hundreds of free services out there, use any one of those and not this company.

Beware this is a scam. Advertised as free QR codes, only found out it was an expensive monthly fee once the QR codes were printed on posters. I was then unable to login to cancel the payments as an email link is required but never arrives. All attempts to contact the company were ignored. I was forced to block my bank payments instead. Miraculously I'm then sent a link which works asking me to pay.I was finally able to login to cancel via the link sent to pay, this function actually doesn't work and takes you in circles. One month later I received a second demand for funds for the account I thought was cancelled!

Very irrational that it advertised unlimited free qr codes. I added it our Christmas cards to connect to a virtual family newsletter. Then sent it to 50 people, family, colleagues, etc. Only to find out when my card was received it told the users I hadn't picked a plan and needed to if I were to use it. It worked before I sent it out. Then stopped working unless I signed up for an expensive monthly fee. Scam! I'll keep my subscription through December, then I'm canceling it. Don't be fooled like me!
Avoid!The website is nice, lets you create a QR code very easily. It is not very clear that after the 7 day trial you are forced to pay $35 a month!!! to continue using their service.

Unclear trial period. All the codes you generate will be deactivated if you are not paying a monthly or yearly subscription. There are free options out there. If you want to make a QR code and don't want to pay $35 a month for it, then don't use this site.

Misleading Website. Beware of hidden Charges...This is not a 'Free QR Code generator' as it states on their site. QR Code stops working after 7 days and turns out there is a 7 day trial which is not clearly stated on their website forcing people to pay 35 $ per month.QR.io your headline screams 'FREE' qr code generator which is of course completely misleading. You are offering a 7 day free trial!! This is not accurate information on your site and has caused me to waste hundreds of business cards and professional roll up posters and banners. Looking at other reviews more people also have fallen for this 'trap'.

Absolute scam. They pull you in with 'free qr code generator' when actually they mean free for 7days. Then it's $35 a month and until you pay your qr codes are useless. This is a predatory business model that is literally designed to scam people. The company and it's employees should be ashamed of themselves. Please note, if you are looking for TRUE free QR codes for life then just Google: 'Free QR code Adobe' and they have an excellent 100% free service that far exceeds this.

Review.Titre: misleading website. Codes stop working after 7 days unless you 35 $ per month
Review.Contenu: After 7 days ‘free qr codes’ stop working all together!!!??? Your headline screams free qr codes which is ofcourse completely misleading. You are offering a 7 day free trial!! I shouldn’t have relied on your website but instead gone to several others who are genuinely free and don’t put people in a difficult position to get them to sign up to an overpriced subscription. I have to throw all my business cards in the bin now, which is actually cheaper to do than pay your subscription of 35$ pmThis should get listed in how not to run a business 101!

Be careful! Its a scam, first they say its a FREE QR code , I made couple and printed 5000 leaflets with them on. After one week I tried to scan the code and it doesn’t work , they ask you to pay for the subscription (35$) PER MONTH !!!!! I wasted my money on ordering leaflets now they have to go to the bin, so much money wasted…….

Gave me a QR code, didn't say anywhere it's not PERMANENT. I printed it on my business cards and now, 7 days later, it's unusable. I mean, I just wanted a QR code, didn't care about all the perks and benefits. It's something that costs nothing to get with other sites. And now asks for 35$/month. This is ridiculous.

Very misleading, created a QR code and printed a bunch of business cards, the QR code didn't work after 7 days of free trial (whereas it's written that it's free and free trial is for the premium features). 35 USD / month just to be able to have my clients read my code...
They say free qr code, then after 7 days they ask for $35 a month or the qr code becomes useless. It's a scam. There are plenty of other qr code generators that are actually free

Review.Titre: I created a QR code under the…
Review.Contenu: I created a QR code under the understanding that it was feee as long as it was not dynamic. But now it won’t work it aka me to upgrade to $35 a month to use it.

DO NOT USE.- SCAM!!Looks legit. Loads of positive reviews- BUT, after 7 days the QR code stops working and re-directs to a $35 monthly subscription.PRETTY EMBARRASSING AND COSTLY FOR US. We printed up a whole load of publicity material, which we distributed widely. MAKES US LOOK VERY UNPROFESSIONAL.
Very complicated.  Find simpler one

Very tricky, misled me into thinking I could get a limited free version and keep it (for those who don't want to pay for unlimited subscription as I only needed 1 code). But actually they only have paid version after 7 days, and its quite expensive as well

This whole website operates a clever little scam where they:1) get user to generate a QR code "for free"2) user prints and distributes materials with QR code3) after 1 week (enough time for the user to distribute their flyer/business cards/invitations), QR code stops working and redirects to an extortion page saying you need to pay, or elseBy the time the week is up, it's too late to switch to a legitimate QR code generator, because materials have already been mailed.If you've been affected, you can:- report them to Stripe (payment processor) - google "stripe fraud report"- open a fraud claim with the ftc via reportfraud.ftc.gov

An unbelievably scummy site. They sneakily change your QR code to a "redirect" style, and nowhere on their page do they explain that after 7 days the redirect will stop working, then they want $35 for a MONTH, for a service that you can get elsewhere for a fraction of the price. It's a horrible business model that only survives by tricking people into becoming customers. PLEASE go ANYWHERE else.

Review.Titre: IS NOT FREE. DO NOT USE
Review.Contenu: Like the majority of the legitimately written reviews... this is a thinly veiled scam, no where is payment mentioned as they let you create a qr code "for free" until a week after you've generated and wasted money on marketing materials. I'd rather pay double and reprint everything then pay this deceptive business

I needed to create a simple QR code for wedding invitations. Their website claimed to be completely free until we realized that all the weddings invites we sent out had a broken QR code, and now we are FORCED to pay $35 a month for the next 6 months. Avoid this website and use QRCode Monkey instead, for an ACTUALLY FREE QR code.

I generated QR codes which I was just about to use in a book I was putting out to print, only to find out that your site is not free to use and that I was on a 7 day free trial. Honesty would be appreciated up front to let users know that your site is a trial site. That way they wouldn't waste precious time.I got the same quote from Adobe for free. Please don't waste people's precious time.

This company is a SCAM. I don’t know how they have so many positive reviews, but they are an absolute scam. They are NOT FREE despite actively marketing themselves as such. I am not nearly as impacted as the NGOs and others who have shared their poor experiences, but it has severely affected my business as well. There are multiple truly free ways to generate QR codes, you absolutely DO NOT need to be paying $35/month for the service, and you SHOULD NOT have to pay if they’re holding your already generated QR codes hostage.

Review.Titre: I feel like I have been mislead
Review.Contenu: When creating my codes, this was not made obvious at all that unless I pay over $30 p/m the codes would stop working after 7 days. So having already printed my codes on a product, I find out that the codes do not work after 7 days. I am not going to pay $30 p/m when I can create QR codes for free on Canva. This looks like a good tool but very overpriced, and I do not appreciate being mislead like this into paying for something.

Yep, like others I thought I was making a static QR code because that's all I needed, but this website defaults to dynamic without telling you. Then, you must pay $35 a month (far, far too much for one code) in order for the code to keep working. Fortunately, I only mailed out a few items, so I made a new code on a free site and stickers to go over these expensive codes. Horrible business.UPDATE: after posting this review and contacting customer support, they offered me a plan to keep my code for $9 a month. So now that I have a premium plan at a more reasonable price, I see there is STILL no way to create a static code. Even though they advertise you can do both dynamic (needs subscription) and static (no subscription needed), they actually only allow you to create dynamic QR codes for which they can charge you. Buyer beware.

Review.Titre: As many of the other reviewers have…
Review.Contenu: As many of the other reviewers have said, this is a scam. I work for a charity and used QR.io to generate a QR code to include on a brochure. A week or so into the project (after I got some brochures printed) I received a notification saying that I needed to pay $35 a month to reactivate the code. Why so much when I can get the same service elsewhere for about $5 a month? So, I've printed some stickers to go over the QR.io versions and will never again touch the services of this unscrupulous company.

Review.Titre: These are NOT free QR codes and it's…
Review.Contenu: These are NOT free QR codes and it's pretty embarrassing when you create a dozen flyers using one of these QR codes, because after a few days of "free" clicks, everyone that scans it will be prompted to give money to qr.io.  It's so gross.

Hands-off! They first let you create a "free" QR code (just asking for your email address), but after a week or so, the link is being redirected to another page - unless you buy a paid subscription for 350 USD a year. This is criminal activity!

'Bulk creation' feature does not work. I spent an extra 40 minutes trying to get it to work, and I did not have time for that. I exported it in the required format, and it kept telling me 'invalid format'. My file and the example looked the same. I had to play detective to figure out how to format it because the example does not make this obvious. I have work experience in Product Design & Management, and I am shocked that this feature made it live, as it does not work. These issues should have been spotted in testing and resolved before the feature was pushed to live. Lazy product work results in frustrating products, and this is a prime example

They talk about free QR codes and when you create a code it falsely shows a QR code that goes to your desired site but then when you try to download it makes you create an account and re-create the QR code to something that routes through their site, which means the QR only works as long as you pay them.

What a piece of scam! I ust generated a smart and pretty QR-code. I LOVED the options for design. Then, about a month later, I get the option of paying for it - after I printed it on my marketing material! It's very obvious that their marketing-scheme is to just pressure people to buying their insane expensive service for 35 UDS a MONTH?! (Or 350 a year, but honestly that doesn't seem like a bargain). I feel really betrayed and hurt that it has to be THAT expensive, cause I'm not above paying for a service. I found others that offer the same thing for 5-10 dollars a month and a better annual deal than this is. Please not fall for this trap!

Review.Titre: You ran out of the 7-days free trial.
Review.Contenu: You ran out of the 7-days free trial.Please, upgrade to the basic plan to get a precise review and improve your system.Only 35 USD for a concise review report.Jokes apart: the service is not what users expect and it doesn't seems to worthy the subscription. There are cheaper and more convenient alternatives on the market. :-)

1) Bad but minor - the bulk upload is clunky - would be easier and less work for most people to upload data in different columns rather than "semicolon delimited"2) Good - you can sort QR codes into folders3) Bad - no bulk download of QR codes or bulk download of a folder - so after a bulk upload - lots of clicking and risk of human error when you download. Facepalm4) Bad - when you download - the platform removes any dashes or underscores in the file name  - so all names are a long string - this makes it more difficult for clients to easily see what's what5) Really Bad - Logos in the QR codes can disappear - e.g. if you download a .png or .svg and then want to move the file elsewhere - it loses the "properties" - this makes it very poor when sharing with third parties. @ QR.ioI'm happy to be corrected on the above - but your help section is also very poor - there aren't even search results for "upload", "download”, “batch” or "batch"In QR.io's defence - I don't understand the 1 star reviews for the "free 7 day trial" - the FAQs clearly state the QR codes will stop after that.

Review.Titre: A subscription to even scan the QR code…
Review.Contenu: A subscription to even scan the QR code I am never making QR codes from you and even if somebody uses you I am asking them to stop using ur QR code make there are beater QR code makers out there 😡😡😡😡😡😡

Very clever SCAM! I found them after Googling Free QR Code Generator and created a QR code, which I then added to 250 leaflets I then ordered. I then got an email to say my 7 day free trial had ended. Throughout the process, there was no mention of a free trial or pricing so the QR code I designed, as well as the 250 leaflets I added it to are useless.I've gone back on the website and there really is no mention of a free trial or price, so please don't get stung like I did!

They leave you with the impression that you get a free QR Code for the link.  However, what they actually do is charge you $350-420 ***PER YEAR** and lock you in by making the QR codes they generate go through a *SLOW* (> 15 seconds) link rerouting site they own and therefore can track who uses the QR code and lock out anyone who does not pay their ridiculous fees.  SCAM!  Avoid!

Advertised on Google as a free QR code service, but after  days it will break your links and and request that you pay $35 per month to re activate the links. Not only is this QR service obscenely overpriced but they deliberately hide the fact that their will be any fee system when you sign up and create a QR code.
just a scam. Does not generate a personal QR code but creates a code to advertise their own services. WASTE OF TIME!

Review.Titre: Unable to cancel account after trial
Review.Contenu: Unable to cancel account. One of those 'try us for free' websites but when it comes to cancelling your trial the delete account sections fails, and is also craftily hidden from view.Had to block their constant emails and report as spam.

After creating my QR Code, I decided to read up on other people's experience with the service, and I'm glad I did. I found that the codes stop working after a few days. That's terrible. It would seem like they are banking on people creating their business cards, flyers, etc., and subscribing in an act of desperation when they find all of their printing and graphic design work is suddenly useless.They should really let people know ahead of time. Maybe less people will impulsively use the site, but at least those who do won't be mislead.

Review.Titre: 20 minutes of futsing around and no…
Review.Contenu: 20 minutes of futsing around and no further ahead.Instructions seem a bit .... weak to say the least.Maybe it doesn't work, but I doubt that.  Just frustrating trying to do this with no background or experience with the system.

I am giving this a 1 star mainly because it is only after I created an account did it become clear to me that this was a free trial. I would bypassed this app entirely if I had known. I only occasionally use a QR code and therefore it doesn't make sense to pay for an account.

Review.Titre: QR code will expire unless paying for an account
Review.Contenu: I had to change my review after realizing I paid and printed for 500 business cards that needed to go out on a rush order. I didn't have time to look up the company and assumed initially the QR code I created will continue to work after my trial. What a disappointment, waste of time and money. I spent $200 on business cards with a QR code that will stop working.

Review.Titre: Create "Free" QR code and then Hold it Hostage Behind Paywall after 7 Days
Review.Contenu: DO NOT USE!  Really unethical business practices here.  They offer that you can generate QR codes for free for seven days, but they don't tell you that they will suddenly be deactivated and held behind a subscription paywall at the end of seven days only after you've printed your QR codes and printed your flyers and materials with them.  Our youth group is raising funds for Ukrainian refugees in Poland and I needed a QR code for the fundraising materials.  After seven days and after sharing all the flyers with the youth to fundraise I received an email from QR.io saying that I would need to now subscribe or the QR code will no longer work.  I contacted customer support and they said they could not help me but offered a discounted "subscription."  No thank you.  Stay away!

Absolute rip off !!!Most providers including adobe give lifetime free qr codes but these guys feel the need to charge £300 a year !!! I generated a code as it said they were free and when my business cards arrived which cost £40 it said I had to pay £300 for a year to re activate my code - fair enough if you had clearly stated you will have to pay but your website says “ free qr code “ which is incorrect and now I am heavily out of pocket . Very dissatisfied with your company
scam. You make qr code for free and when printer printed  bags, code redirect to the there site asking to pay it for to be activated.

Wouldn't use again. Created a design with their free QR tool, but in order to download, it's required to create an account. This deletes the design you just made. I had to create the design 5 times to get to a download, and it now says 7 day free trial. I'll use another free service next time.

This company advertises free QR Codes (trial) with little information regarding what happens to the codes generated after the free trial.  We have yard signs that were meant to be used ANNUALLY (i.e. an investment) with a QR code that no longer works unless one has the budget to cover 35/month or 350 annually.  Really?  What organization looking for a free QR code to use for a charity event would have an extra $350 laying around?  Deceptive, and ridiculously expensive for what you get.  If it were $5 a month to cover using it, well, that would make sense for the little you receive in return.

SCAM COMPANY - DO NOT USEFirst of all, I just scrolled through the reviews here on trust pilot and most 5 star reviews are made from profiles with one review history- that should be a major red flag.Usually I’m pretty aware, but I guess you do slip and fall sometimes. In a hurry I generated a QR code for a business card. Keep in mind that a QR code is a completely free thing to generate and should not cost ANY money!Accidentally I generated what qr.io calls a dynamic QR code. This comes with a 7 days trial period and after that it’s crazy expensive. At no point during the generation was I informed about the trial period nor the price. It wasn’t clearly stated that I was generating a “dynamic QR code”Now it’s printed out and completely useless. I reached out to the company and they offered a one time payment to “activate” the code. This is a completely scam for something that is free.I don’t need to change the code or use any “features” just needed it to work.I refuse to pay for something that’s FREE and rather get new stuff printed, with a new QR code, then pay money to this scam of a company.With all the missing information about this “product” before generating a code I think this “company” should probably think them self happy any the fact that they are not based in the EU.STAY AWAY

Review.Titre: I quit my trial in time - still got charged 35$ !
Review.Contenu: I have registered my qr.io account on Sept. 29th and quit my 7-day free trial a couple of days later. Unfortunately, the company still charged 35$ from my bank account, which is unacceptable.

I've cancelled the subscription 4 months ago but keep getting billed every month. I`ve contacted customer support twice and nothing has been solved.THIS COMPANY IS A SCAMEDIT: they have contacted me in september and told me it was finally cancelled. A month later, now in October, I got billed twice. This a damn joke.

I just deleted my glowing 5-star review. At the time I created the code, everything pointed to the service being free...nowhere did it mention it was for a 7-day trial period. I was horrified when I scanned the code after I'd rolled them out in a published work and the link took me to their website! I went back to the sign-up page, thinking I must've missed something, but it was the same false advertising, tricking people into paying for a subscription after the fact.I'm leaving this review because this shady business has the potential to cause some serious damage, especially if you're not looking to commit to a long-term subscription plan.The service itself is stellar, but I just can't get behind tricking people out of their money.

This is a scam! We used a code generated by QR.io on printed materials, nowhere during this process do they warn you that they will deactivate your QR Code if you don't pay them after a week. We lost sales and ended up having to pay $30 just to keep the code functioning. DO NOT USE QR.io!

I love that it was apparently a free app, but after 7 days the app no longer worked without paying a large fee for it.  It was almost like they had you over a barrel, because once you’ve distributed this QR code, you either pay their fee or have to change all your marketing.  I would not recommend.

Review.Titre: No way are these reviews legit, this is a SCAM
Review.Contenu: There is no way the reviews for this product are legitimate. This website acts like the QR codes are free, then after a week deactivates them and demands an insanely expensive subscription.Naturally, this all happened after we'd got the posters and flyers for our event printed. Absolute disgrace.

EDITED to say they provided a satisfactory resolution.TOTAL scam. if they had been transparent about a fee up front, I probably would have just paid it. Instead they present lke they are free and gve you enough time to distribute the code and then lock it, forcing you to upgrade to a $35 / month fee, wasting any money you spent on printed materials.

Review.Titre: Idk why but my account was deleted and…
Review.Contenu: Idk why but my account was deleted and now I can’t use QR codes. Trying to open my account again and the website is soooo confusing it doesn’t help at alll!!

The site advertises "static code will remain active after trial period." I spent $150 on cards, flyers etc, believing my code would still work after a week. I just tested it out today. It's been a week since I created it- and it's blocked. They want $35 a month. I was on their Facebook page. People report a similar experience to mine. They also report difficulty stopping the subscription.I reached out to the company. Waiting to hear back. I'll be throwing out all my print advertising and starting with another company. I feel extorted by this company.11/16 Response: They replied to my email. They offered me a lower amount per month.   I don't need to know how many people click through the code.  I don't need to make multiple new codes a month. I need to keep my costs under control. The promotional items I bought will last me 3 to 5 years.  The interface to make the QR codes is fantastic.  They have managed to be the top of all search engines. I wasn't impressed with their response to me as a consumer. The website still has not cleared up the poor communication. It is not yet managing expectations to a degree most people will be able to use the service without problems. I would recommend people use another site.  I was not impressed with their follow up with me.11/17/23 Another response: Yesterday morning, after my TrustPilot complaint, another person from the company reached out to me.  Said they would activate my account for life.   I didn't check it yesterday but I checked it this morning.   It's not on.
nice interface but sadly a classic "lock-in" strategy. They generate a free code and ask for money once you want to start using it. Go die with your greedy capitalist attitude!
not an honest company. said nothing about a monthly subscription until i ordered 250$ worth of business cards and now you want 35$ a month? Eat s&%$.

words can't even describe what just happened, this site claimed to be a "free business card generator" yet a week later I get an email that "my free trial expired" and that I would need to pay 35 USD a MONTH just to have my code working, I already printed business cards.... NEVER USE THIS

There is no way this company should be allowed to operate. They are a scam who back you into a corner by giving you a "free code" but when someone goes to use it 7 days late it is inactive and you have to pay to reactivate it. This financially damaged our non for profit sports club.

Review.Titre: NO TRANSPARENCY FOR $35 PER MONTH! TOTAL SCAM.
Review.Contenu: There's no way they received such high ratings here, as you can see – most 5-star reviews are recent and might be ordered by them. We used their website last year for a non-profit organization building a school in Africa and then suddenly it charged us USD 35 per month for people to be able to scan our QR (now it is directed to their site). Mind you, we have printed thousands of business cards to gather donations. I hope their CEO/Founder reads this so they know how UNETHICAL their business is and it should be categorized as a scam. They never made it transparent that you had to pay for their service and there is no way their service is worth USD 35 per month. We don't need analytics or fancy frames, we only need QR codes.

Review.Titre: Lack of transparency has meant we're now struggling to balance our wedding budget
Review.Contenu: Generated a QR code for my wedding invites; we did this because it was a free QR code and it meant we didn't need to spend a fortune (or hours of emailing or money on extra info invites) to get the details of our wedding out. The QR code worked before I ordered my invites so I ordered them. As soon as my invites arrive (which cost enough in their own right), the code stops working and they want £28 per MONTH to reactivate it. When I set this up, there was no clear information about having to subscribe to keep it open. It is also 3 times more expensive than most of its competitors. I now have to create a new FREE QR code with another company and reprint all of my invites which is a cost we cannot afford. I am absolutely devastated by this as we have a very tight wedding budget and have tried to do everything ourselves. There is so little transparency with QR.io. It is a complete con and now I am back to square one.

Review.Titre: Be warned, this isn’t free as advertised.
Review.Contenu: Found QR.IO by searching for “Free QR Code generator”. Set one up for a charity / just giving page which was laser printed onto wooden medals for a fund raising running event. I had no message to say the link had expired and it now resolves to an error page. I can either pay $35 per month or have the error and no-one can donate to the charity. At no point on the creation page or the welcome email does it warn you of this, otherwise I would have chosen another service that wasn’t designed to entrap people into paying. Terrible.

SCAM!! stops working after 7 days and they you're stuck being billed stupid amounts of money. "free qr code" is a lie, and a scam. Their responses on Trustpilot are also the same generic thing, no care for customers.

Recently, I had the unfortunate experience of using Qr.io for my business needs, and I am compelled to share my dissatisfaction. Initially, the service seemed promising, offering the creation of QR codes, which appeared to be free. However, this turned out to be misleading. Major Issues:1. Deceptive Pricing: The QR code I created was deactivated after 7 days, revealing a hidden catch - a subscription fee of $35 per month to keep it active. This pricing is exorbitant, especially considering the basic nature of the service provided.2. Poor Customer Service: My attempts to address this issue with their team were met with indifference. Instead of acknowledging their deceptive practices, they offered a slightly reduced price of $12/month or a one-time purchase of $50, which still didn't justify the value.In conclusion, Qr.io's service was not only disappointing but also seemed to employ questionable business practices. The hidden costs, lack of proper customer support, and overall approach to business are concerning. I advise potential customers to be wary of these issues and consider other more transparent and cost-effective options available in the market. Rating: 1/5 - Highly Disappointing

Review.Titre: Have been charged without any email…
Review.Contenu: Have been charged without any email notification for months and there is no way to unsubscribe.

Absolute scam. There is no way the five star reviews for this company are legitimate. I used them for a client of mine and now their marketing material is unusable. Deplorable practice.

This happened after I’d printed all my posters and flyers for my festival show. I was trapped. Which is what this company relies on to keep their scam going. I hope they shut down. And there’s no way anyone gave them legitimate positive reviews. Horrendous business. Evil.

Review.Titre: Please dont use QR.io if you are…

I got in touch with them as I had generated the QR added to WEDDING INVITES and had them printed! Review.Titre: Charged double the listed price and customer service is unresponsive
Review.Contenu: Edited on Thursday, October 26 to add - We have continued to try to reach Lucy and still no response._____Edited on Wednesday, October 4 to add- Lucy was contacted per the standard copy-and-paste response from QR.io and have yet to receive a response.____We have contacted customer service via the provided email 4 times over the past 3 months and no one will respond. We have provided a phone number and no one will call us. We can't call them because they do not have a published phone number.The card they continue to charge has not been on file for 2 months and yet they keep charging it? We paid $350 for the annual subscription. The QR code was paused briefly (less than a month). When it was reactivated we were again charged the $350 yearly rate. Bottomline - Customer Service is unresponsive and they will continue to charge your card. We've been charged $700 for the annual ($350) subscription. I do not recommend QR.io. If I could give them a zero, I would because they have provided zero support.

FAKE ADVERTISING & SCAMMING: Advertises as a free QR code generator then tries to scheme you out of money 7 days later. I used this because it was advertised as free. Created my QR code, printed it out on flyers, and handed those flyers out. Only after 7 days did I find out that my QR code was deactivated and I had to pay up to keep it active. This puts people in a horrible position: Do I just pay up so the hard work of printing and giving out the flyers doesn't go to waste? I contacted customer service asking them kindly to just extend my free trial for a few more days just until the day of my event. Mind you, this "free trial" I didn't even know I was using because they do not tell you you are in a trial and must pay $40 after. Customer service refused to extend my free trial and/or help in any way or form. BEWARE - avoid at all costs. Go use any other free QRcode like bitly etc.

Review.Titre: I used QR.io to create a QR code for a corporate partnership
Review.Contenu: I used QR.io to create a QR code for a corporate partnership, and at no stage was it made clear or obvious that the code was part of a free trial and that it would be deactivated almost immediately without payment. Clearly, this setup is designed to place users in a bind where they need to sign up, or risk their project being ruined (QR codes are usually used for print). I would have considered a subscription had the communications around this been more clear, but the experience has entirely put me off.
Qr.io presents itself as a free qr generator. Then seven days later turns off the code to extort money from the user. These are underhanded business practices. Don’t trust them.

Review.Titre: This site is not free, don't let yourself be scammed.

The business cards have already been printed and distributed and my only option is to let myself be scammed and pay.What really shocks me is seeing all the reviews and how many others have been scammed like me, and this website has STILL not been changed to make it clear that after the free trial you need to pay a subscription or your codes stop working and are useless.A good option would be to let customers pay a one time fee to buy single QR codes they have already used.

Review.Titre: WARNING: YOU ARE GETTING A TRIAL
Review.Contenu: This is the sort of backwards, unethical, and deceptive marketing that I hate most about companies. At no point during the sign up process are you informed you are creating a "free account" for a 7 day trial. After the trial expires you are left with nothing, your QR codes are held to ransom, and so if, like me, you've used them for a business card... Well pay up, or get some more business cards. At $35 a month, the "premium" features of 1) Having the ability to HAVE a QR codeand2) Adding a little picture in the middleis extortionate, leading me to believe that this company runs off the ransom model I mentioned earlier.Avoid.Disclaimer to avoid a "The notice was there" message: When you RETURN to your dashboard, but not when you first enter it, a banner does appear telling you you are on a 7-day free trial. But a free account with no features is just an email address on somebody else's list.

Please read this before trying this website!!!!!!!!!I am absolutely disgusted by this company. So shameful, can't describe it any other way. So you print out your marketing materials and boom - after few days you'll get an email about paused QR codes (they are not working!!!!) and required payment. Tell me how this is not an EXTORTION. I'm so disgusted I can't describe it with words. I saw a lot on internet, but never a website taking such an advantage of people. Please report this anywhere you can, this is the only way to stop them.

Review.Titre: Free trial out to trick people!
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately as with others I failed to spot the 'Free Trial' element that was not mentioned to me at any stage in the creation of my QR code. It was only when I got emails just over a week later saying my free trial had ended that I realised this and that my QR code which needed to be active had been deactivated.When you read the FAQs it tells you there is a difference between dynamic and static QR codes, and that only your static codes will stay active after the free trial. When you set up a QR code, the option to choose a static code is hidden at the bottom of all of the options in greyed out text which I only found when I went back in looking for this option. It doesn't even look like an active link.Definitely a company that are out to trick people and not clear in their options up front. Have rated 2 as the QR code itself does work well. I've very reluctantly paid for a month to keep using the QR code which I need for a short while but will then be cancelling and never using again.

Review.Titre: Great customer service, but they don't tell you free QR codes expire
Review.Contenu: The custom QR code configurator is easy to use and has lots of options. The customer service department of this company is outstanding, and the primary reason I am giving four stars. BE WARNED that if you make a "free" QR code using the customization tool on the home page, it will stop working in a week when your free trial expires, as qr.io by default forces free QR codes to go through a forwarding URL so that they can discontinue service if you do not buy a subscription. Don't be like me and buy a bunch of prints with the free code on them, they will be useless in 7 days. That being said, even though I did not even pay for a subscription, I had multiple customer service representatives reach out to me to try to rectify my situation, and they were consistently professional, courteous, and generous. I would recommend using this service if you regularly need QR codes or if you run a business that would benefit from these services and the reliable support offered by qr.io.Second edit: This problem of not telling people their free code will expire has existed for quite some time. There are dozens if not hundreds of reviews over the past 18 months of people using a supposedly free code and having access cut off without warning. One person even used these codes for wedding invitations only to be forced into a $35/month subscription fee when the code stopped working. I have taken an additional star off due to the apparent lack of concern this company has for people getting duped by their trap.

We recently used QR.io for a fundraising event in our community. We took advantage of the free seven day trial period and then got notice we would be charged a $35 monthly fee. We felt dupped into paying so our flyers with QR codes would work. Very deceptive. Not a great way to generate business or faith in consumers!!

The fact that it’s a 7 day trial is blended in and very easy to miss. Seems kinda skemish to me. Should be made so people know they are going to be charged $35 a month after 7 days to keep the QE code they just generated active. Other than that the QR codes are great. I love you can chose your colors and personalize it to fit your business.

Review.Titre: I don't know if my QR code will expire
Review.Contenu: I like the options available but I do not like that there is nothing that tells me whether the QR code I made is static or dynamic. If it's dynamic, it will expire unless I upgrade and pay money. I made it after clicking the "static" option so I'm *assuming* it's a static code, but when I click the "dynamic" option, it refreshes the page to show the QR code I already made. So now I have a cool looking code that I can't even use for promotional materials because I don't know if it will expire next week.

EDIT: Okay so since posting this review QR.io have been in contact and have resolved our specific issue in a great way, very friendly support staff, who were able to refund us the money we had spent and upgraded our account as a good will gesture so our QR codes will now work without the sub. I am upgrading the review to three stars because of the response from customer support, however two stars deducted for the experience overall. DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE - QR.io have conveniently forgotten to inform customers in anyway prior to using their service that it is only free for 7 days, after which the dynamic qr code will not work unless you pay £28 a month or ten times that for a year. Total disgrace. They are also making a habit or not cancelling subscriptions in a timely manner. They also automatically set the qr codes to dynamic when you are creating them. Only the static we codes are free and you only learn this after reading through a lot of small print.In my opinion this is predatory and QR.io need to add this information in a clear and understandable format so people are given the info whilst they are creating their codes… before they are trapped by their service.

Review.Titre: Be aware of cost but overall good service
Review.Contenu: I only needed one QR code for a work project. Everything seemed fine until our customers began scanning the QR codes. Suddenly, the QR code was no longer free. Out of nowhere my QR code is deactivated and the only way to reactivate it is to pay $35, and not a one time payment but MONTHLY! This is ridiculous and once I no longer need access to my QR code I am never using this site again. I would caution anyone else to steer clear of making QR codes with this website because it is a scam. They make false promises and then use your need to extract money from you.I wrote the above review after having a poor experience with the QR.io, but after my review was posted the level of customer service I received was wonderful. I have since used the site more and am happy with its capabilities. I would say that it definitely meets my needs, and for anyone looking to use the service in the future I wouldn't advise against as long as they were aware of whether or not they would be charged.

Although I would have preferred it to be free, like it is on some other websites, the discounted price was much better and the customer service I had was friendly with quick responses.

Review.Titre: Good platform, but be careful with the trial
Review.Contenu: ** Edit ** The issue mentioned below was resolved after being contacted by them through this review. Thankfully, they were understanding and allowed me to keep the QR code active. Beyond that misfortune, I must admit that their platform is well-made and easy to use. If your business requires making QR codes on a regular basis, it is definitely a service worth considering. Original review: Unless you plan on using their paid services, do not use QR.io. I recently made a QR code using their platform on the free trial. Their advertising put me under the impression that the codes made during the trial would stay active. So I had business cards made and printed using their service. When I received my business cards printed, I was disappointed to realize that the QR code did not work, essentially rendering them worthless. Then, I contacted them about it. They offered me to pay 50 USD to keep the QR code active. I felt cornered into either having to waste money to keep a QR code alive or waste money to get new business cards printed with a functional QR code. From other reviews online, I see I'm not the only one. There are other truly free services to get QR codes done with similar functionalities, and I recommend anyone looking to make a QR code and doesn't need any fancy features to NOT use QR.io. It might not legally be a scam, but their behaviour of cornering people into paying them to avoid wasting money they put into printing QR codes after being misled by their advertising is certainly akin to that of scammers.

Review.Titre: This company does not make clear that…

Review.Titre: Quick and painless QR code set up
Review.Contenu: Quick and painless QR code set up. I was happy to see that it was actually free, like advertised, since another site I tried had false advertising. Only reason I didn't do 5 stars was because when you scan the QR code, while the website is loading, the URL shows "qr.codes" before loading the intended website URL. I'm not sure if this is standard, but I don't recall seeing that in other times I've used QR codes. Overall, I would recommend using them to create your code. It was very easy, and there was a good amount of customization options.

The website is very good and easy to use to create QR codes. However, you need to know that it is not free, as it seems at first, it will cost a monthly fee (which is not really mentioned before the QR code gets blocked after the 7 day free trial has ended) to keep the QR code active. However, the customer service is very responsive, and after speaking to Lucy from QR.io via Email, we were able to arrange a solution and reduce this unexpected cost.

After I posted on here, Lucy sorted it all for me, so I've updated my review as everything is ok now. Thank you.

Unfortunately that isn't exactly transparent on the website and I ran into the issue that the code which I had already used in print suddenly became unusable. Luckily, customer support was very helpful and proactive in solving the problem. I hope they will make it more clear in the future, because otherwise it's a great service.

Review.Titre: Change of mind for excellent Customer Service

QR.io provide a simple and effective service to generate codes. And don't do what I did and go to print with an inappropriate code!Otherwise I'd highly recommend QR.io

Review.Titre: Be careful when making QR codes
Review.Contenu: Be careful when making QR codesUpdate! I have received great customer service since this review was made and I’m very pleased with how much they cared about my situation. I will continue to use Qr.io, however still be careful of which QR code you’re making. -BenOriginal review:I made a qr code and there was no mention at all of the insane $350 dollar yearly fee that would come once your 7 day free trial ended. I then put these qr codes on 250 of my business cards so now I'm going to be forced to pay a monthly bill just so my business cards work. I am not very happy at all with how things presented themselves. They give you the "Option" to choose a static or dynamic qr code, but their "static" option is a tiny fine print option at the bottom of the page which you will never find or see unless you're looking for it. Moral of the story, make sure you know everything before setting something in stone. I was a fool and now I'm literally paying for it. Other than that however the program works great and does what it says it does

Review.Titre: A rocky start, with a great ending!
Review.Contenu: Creating and setting up our QR.io code was simple. The website was user-friendly as well. The only issue we ran into was that we didn't realize the QR code was not free, rather we had only received a 1 week's trial. After receiving an email asking us to pay to continue using the QR code, we immediately reached out to customer service since the prices were out of our price range. Thankfully they responded very promptly and they were able to provide us with a few options that worked better within our budget so we could get the most use out of our QR code!

Review.Titre: PLEASE DON’T MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE I DID!!!
Review.Contenu: I used this website to create QR codes to help me promote my self-published book as I thought they were free. I have very little money and was excited to add a QR code to my bookmarks for the children to find some extra stuff online. Having paid for 200 bookmarks, I find out that the QR codes no longer work and to reactivate them I’d have to pay monthly or yearly. It was not made clear at all that I was on a free trial and hearing other people it sounds like this is intentional to suck you in. I’m devastated that I’ve wasted the little money I did have on these bookmarks that will no longer function. EDIT: The company contacted me to say that they were upgrading me to the premium plans for free. The customer service is actually quite good. I will say the QR codes are fun to customise and offer lots of options. Just make sure you understand the free trial rules and how it works!
Creation of the QR code was easier than expected.
The app did what it was supposed to do.

Very good service, works well. It would be handier to be able to go one step back after creating a QR and retain the entered text. Adding a custom logo only worked two times, after that a SVG logo was no longer added to the QR (default ones did)

Review.Titre: Great product, but don't appreciate pricing that isn't obvious
Review.Contenu: The QR codes, flexibility of design and tracking are excellent. I would have rated  a 5. The reason I did not is because the pricing is not obvious to quick users. You don't see the fees unless you scroll to the bottom or complete the 7 day free trial you didn't realize you were in. The company comes up if you search for "free qr code generator." But the product is not free (except for the 7 day trial). That being said, it is a good product and we did go on with a paid plan for the tracking purposes - and because we had already printed products with the qr codes before we had the notice that our "free trial" had expired and now the qr codes we generated were not active. As most should know however, anything that sounds too good to be true, probably is. So, I blame myself for not searching out the site further. Were there a "pricing" tab in the header with clear information before getting hooked, I'd give the product 5 stars.

I used this website to create a single QR code, which I thought was free. Unfortunately, I didn't read the small print and soon realised that I had a free one week trial, and that the code would expire without further payment. The company were very helpful in providing a suitable alternative to cover the cost, by considerably reducing my monthly membership cost.

Review.Titre: They expired my "free" QR code but eventually made it right.
Review.Contenu: My first impression of qr.io was that it seemed a useful service worthy checking out in the initial free trial.  I created and used a QR code and it worked fine until the end of the free trial period, when qr.io informed me that not only did my ability to create QR codes end with the trial period, the code I had created was now not going to function anymore unless I paid them $35/month.  It had never occurred to me that they would disable my QR code and hold it hostage until I paid them money to keep it alive.  That resulted in my first, very negative, review here.  However, upon seeing that review, qr.io quickly contacted me and offered a very satisfactory resolution, which I happily accepted.  They didn't ask me to change the review, but I am changing it to reflect my appreciation for their having rectified the situation through excellent customer service.  I can't quite get to five stars because of the substantial miscommunication of their initial offer, but I can go with four stars happily.  The service still looks useful, albeit a bit pricey.  Just beware that the free trial period is not just for creating QR codes but also for having them continue to function, which I've recommended to qr.io that they disclose when you sign up for the free trial.

Carolina was very kind to offer me two options; either a discount per month or a one-time payment. We ended up with the one-time payment, and it was easily done. We received a one-time payment link and the qr-code worked again the second we paid. Thank you for the quick service, Carolina! I didn't give five stars because of the seven days trial, which could have been communicated better, or a better view of the differences between a static and a dynamic code.
